H0.text: Farthings were in use in England as coinage from the 13th century and ceased to be legal tender on 31 December 1960. How many of them were there in a pound (1). 480

H1.text: Farthings were in use in England as coinage from the 13th century and ceased to be legal tender on 31 December 1960. How many of them were there in a pound (1). 800

H2.text: Farthings were in use in England as coinage from the 13th century and ceased to be legal tender on 31 December 1960. How many of them were there in a pound (1). 200

H3.text: Farthings were in use in England as coinage from the 13th century and ceased to be legal tender on 31 December 1960. How many of them were there in a pound (1). 960

A4.text: The penny was subdivided into 4 farthings until 31 December 1960, when they ceased to be legal tender in the UK and Ireland.

A5.text: The last £sd coins to cease being legal tender in the UK after Decimal Day were the sixpence (withdrawn 1980), the shilling (withdrawn 1991) and the florin (withdrawn 1993).

A6.text: The farthing (1⁄4d) had been demonetised on 1 January 1961.
